intro: Astragalus echinus var. libanoticus, commonly known as the Lebanotic Hare’s-foot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
